featured.text: V2V works by using wireless signals to send information back and forth between cars about their location, speed and direction, so that they keep safe distances from each other.
A blind man can get into a car and travel safely.
The car doors were still locked, the windows tightly shut, and on the back seat were their two jackets.
The car was moving so fast that it went through the highway-dividing fence, resulting in a collision in which five people died.

other.text: Google, which already uses prototypes of such cars to ferry its staff along Californian freeways, once put a blind man in a prototype and filmed him being driven off to buy takeaway hamburgers.
The man was severely injured in last weekend’s tragic car accident and died _____ afterwards.
The author's statement about the highway fence's ability to retain a smaller and lighter car (A) is the author's assumption.
Cars in the future will be characterized by their use of gasoline.
Most men take off their hats in my car, and sometimes I have to tell passengers to put out their cigarettes.
(J) whose car was stolen.
Badly injured in the car accident, Jason could ____
Rapid advancement in motor engineering makes it _____ possible to build a flying car in the near future.
In this line of work, the person is paid to do daring actions that are deemed too 21 for the regular actor to perform, including jumping from heights, crashing cars, or fighting with weapons.
Which of the following is NOT a potential benefit of driverless cars?
A variety of driver assistance technologies are appearing on new cars.
All passengers riding in cars are required to fasten their seatbelts in order to reduce the risk of _____ in case of an accident.
Mary wrote a letter of to the manufacturer after her new car broke down three times in the same week.
Moreover, a number of firms are creating cars that drive themselves to a chosen destination without a human at the controls.
A lighter and smaller car probably wouldn't have gone through the fence, its remaining energy would have been much less, and this would have reduced the chances of serious injury or death.
You may experience the discomfort from the motion of cars, boats, or amusement park rides.
Although Maggie has been physically _____ to her wheelchair since the car accident, she does not limit herself to indoor activities.
The production of driverless cars is still far away.
In the United States, the legal blood alcohol limit is 0.08% for people aged 21 years or older, while people under 21 are not allowed to drive a car with any level of alcohol in their body.
What is the author's main point in the passage above? (A) Large cars should be banned by the government.
If you are traveling, reserve seats where motion is felt the least, such as the front row of a car or forward cars of a train.
I was back at the car in less than five minutes 37 !
If and when cars go completely driverless, the benefits will be enormous.
Agree to use each other’s cars, and you can save bucks on car rentals, too.
It is predicted that driverless cars will be ready for sale within five years.
It is absolutely _____ to waste your money on an expensive car when you cannot even get a driver’s license.
Because of its small size, it might have missed the other car completely.

In a panic (B) With delight (C) Out of sorrow (D) Filled with embarrassment 39. (A) they had seen my car (B) there was a shop nearby (C) they had seen two small girls (D) there was a police station in the neighborhood 40.
I jumped out of the car, ran round to open the trunk and there inside 40 .
Robert was the only _____ to the car accident.
Intersections will operate in a way that cars automatically adjust their speed to cross through, while maintaining safe distances from other vehicles.
What can be inferred from the passage? (A) Cars will refuse to start if the driver is drunk.
More and more new cars can reverse-park, read traffic signs, maintain a safe distance in steady traffic and brake automatically to avoid crashes.
Now, with the emergence of self-driving cars, researchers have begun to suggest that traffic signals are no longer necessary.

definition.zh_def: 一種用於運輸的機動車輛，通常有四個輪子，並由引擎驅動。
definition.en_def: A motor vehicle used for transportation, typically having four wheels and powered by an engine.
definition.example: She drove her car to work every day.
